image.altText: A woman in profile

items.synopsis: Multiple Victorian home owners have made complaints to the state's building authority over allegedly defective works they say have left them hundreds of thousands of dollars out of pocket.

title.children: Rebekah thought she was building her 'forever home'. Now she's paying a mortgage for work that needs to be torn down

image.altText: A German Empire flag.

items.synopsis: Born out of anti-government rallies during the pandemic, authorities say Germany's Reichsbürger movement is a growing threat. And it's forging ties with one of the country's biggest political parties.

title.children: A fake country: The wild theory gaining traction in one of Europe's most stable nations

image.altText: A young white woman leaning next to a house window

items.synopsis: Ruby Callaghan has tried for six months to stop one of the world's retail giants from charging her unwanted fees. The federal government says it is looking at introducing legislation, known as "don't be a jerk laws", to help curb the issue.

title.children: Ruby tried to cancel her Amazon account in March, but got stuck in a 'subscription trap'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese standing in front of "VOTE YES" branding as he announces the date of the Voice to Parliament referendum

items.synopsis: Whichever way the referendum goes, there will be enormous ramifications for reconciliation and Indigenous advancement. There will be political consequences felt all the way to the next election — and the next six weeks absolutely matter, writes David Speers.

title.children: Two sides, six weeks, one crucial question: Prepare for a new type of campaign as Yes and No chase the 'Big Mo'

image.altText: A composite image of Anthony Albanese and Jacinta Nampijinpa Price

items.synopsis: Yes and No advocates will spend the first full day of the formal Voice to Parliament referendum campaign targeting the swing states of South Australia and Tasmania.

title.children: Tasmania, South Australia focus of Voice advocates on first full day of formal campaign

image.altText: A group of pedestrians walking along a footpath by the Yarra River on a sunny day.

items.synopsis: The approaching new season follows a dry winter for the east coast, and records broke in major cities for the warmest winter on record.

title.children: Record winter warmth signals a spring scorcher this year

image.altText: Ron Pattenden with imagery of ACBF documentation in the background.

items.synopsis: Five former directors and officers of the failed funeral insurer Youpla are facing fines, after the corporate watchdog ASIC commenced civil proceedings over an arrangement to send the funds to a company in Vanuatu.

title.children: ASIC takes 'rare' legal action against former directors of failed funeral insurer Youpla

image.altText: Rudy Giuliiani with cameras in his face and a peacock in front of a moon

items.synopsis: This morning's news, as it happens.

title.children: Rudy Giuliani found liable for defamation, rare blue moon seen around the world. The latest news with The Loop

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The top Republican in the US Senate, Mitch McConnell, has frozen up during a media conference for the second time. During a public appearance in Kentucky, Mitch McConnell was responding to questions from reporters when he froze up, staring into space and not responding to anyone for more than 30 seconds. In late July, Senator McConnell froze in the middle of a press conference at the US Capitol and had to be led away. An aide to Mr McConnell said he felt "light headed" and would consult with a doctor before his next public event.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Mitch McConnell freezes for second time during press conference

children.content: The top Republican in the US Senate, Mitch McConnell, has frozen up during a media conference for the second time.
During a public appearance in Kentucky, Mitch McConnell was responding to questions from reporters when he froze up, staring into space and not responding to anyone for more than 30 seconds.
In late July, Senator McConnell froze in the middle of a press conference at the US Capitol and had to be led away.
An aide to Mr McConnell said he felt "light headed" and would consult with a doctor before his next public event.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Donald Trump's former lawyer Rudy Giuliani is liable for defaming two Georgia election workers who were the target of vote-rigging conspiracy accusations following the 2020 US presidential election. A Washington judge issued the order as a sanction against Mr Giuliani for failing to turn over electronic records sought by the two Fulton County election workers. The judge found Mr Giuliani refused to comply with a process for producing records, known as discovery, and rejected his argument that the election workers used the lawsuit to harass him. "Donning a cloak of victimisation may play well on a public stage to certain audiences, but in a court of law this performance has served only to subvert the normal process of discovery in a straight-forward defamation case," she wrote in her order.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Rudy Giuliani's defamation trial to go ahead

children.content: Donald Trump's former lawyer Rudy Giuliani is liable for defaming two Georgia election workers who were the target of vote-rigging conspiracy accusations following the 2020 US presidential election.
A Washington judge issued the order as a sanction against Mr Giuliani for failing to turn over electronic records sought by the two Fulton County election workers.
The judge found Mr Giuliani refused to comply with a process for producing records, known as discovery, and rejected his argument that the election workers used the lawsuit to harass him.

"Donning a cloak of victimisation may play well on a public stage to certain audiences, but in a court of law this performance has served only to subvert the normal process of discovery in a straight-forward defamation case," she wrote in her order.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A rare blue supermoon dazzled stargazers. It was the second full moon of August, thus the blue label. And it was unusually close to Earth, therefore a supermoon.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Rare blue moon seen around the globe

children.content: It was the second full moon of August, thus the blue label. And it was unusually close to Earth, therefore a supermoon.

props.alt: The August Super Blue Moon sets behind a historical building and the St. Basil's Cathedral
A full moon rises behind a mountain with Greek ruins.
A full moon known as the "Blue Moon" rises behind the Galata Tower in Istanbul, Turkey
A peacock sits on a chimney in front of the moon.

image.altText: A native Australian bee sits on a purple flower.

items.synopsis: As insect populations decline, researchers and start-ups are looking to tech as a solution. But some fear it may create more harm.

title.children: AI bee communication, robot pollination and smart beehives: Can technology replace insects?

image.altText: A view shows a portrait of Wagner mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin at a makeshift memorial.

items.synopsis: The Kremlin says that investigators are considering the possibility that the plane carrying mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin was downed on purpose, the first explicit acknowledgement that he may have been assassinated.

title.children: Kremlin says Prigozhin's death may have been a 'deliberate atrocity'

image.altText: PROXY: Qatar Qantas composite

items.synopsis: Two former heads of the national competition watchdog say the federal government's move to block Qatar Airways' request for extra flights to protect Qantas decreases competition and leaves travellers worse off.

title.children: 'I don't think anyone swallows that story': Flight Centre boss lashes government for putting Qantas before customers

image.altText: A group of people waving placards that call for an end to a coal-to-hydrogen project.

items.synopsis: Environmentalists say a proposal to produce hydrogen from Victorian coal in Latrobe Valley should be abandoned, but those backing the project are seeking to commercialise it.

title.children: 'It has no place in Victoria': Protesters seek end of coal-to-hydrogen project

image.altText: A composite image of Richard Fejo and Helen Secretary side-by-side.

items.synopsis: The Northern Territory has been at the forefront of Australia's Aboriginal land rights movement for decades. But not everyone is sure the Voice will bring positive outcomes.

title.children: They want the same outcomes for their people, but only one of these Larrakia leaders wants a Voice

image.altText: A view of the Liddell coal-fired power plant from across a lake, with swans in the foreground

items.synopsis: Much of the national power grid is facing substantial reliability problems over the next decade, and as soon as this summer, without rapid investment in both electricity generation and transmission.

title.children: National energy grid facing peak pressures over hotter months

image.altText: A Samoan woman sitting in red and black patterned outfit with short white hair and red flower behind her ear.

items.synopsis: Samoa's Prime Minister Fiame Naomi Mata'afa has raised deep concerns about the mass exodus of Pacific Island workers to Australia and New Zealand.

title.children: Pacific countries are not 'outposts' to grow labourers for Australia, Samoan PM says

image.altText: A woman surfs the internet through her Blackberry in Jakarta

items.synopsis: The 20-year-old network is still relied on by older mobile phones, baby monitors and medical devices.

title.children: Australia's biggest telcos are pulling the pin on their 3G networks, and it won't just be old mobile phones affected

image.altText: A group of four people dressed in white PPE and wearing red vests stand around an unmarked grave.

items.synopsis: Sudan's body retrievers pick through debris in a war zone to find the bodies of those killed in the country’s months-long civil war. The task is filled with hazards and could be deadly.

title.children: Afrah spends her days scouring a war-torn land for the dead. The task could kill her

image.altText: Mitch Marsh plays a drive on the back foot as South Africa's wicketkeeper Tristan Stubbs watches

items.synopsis: Mitch Marsh leads Australia to a massive 111-run win over South Africa with a scorching 92 not out, while Tanveer Sangha chips in with four wickets.

title.children: Australia crushes Proteas in Twenty20 series opener

image.altText: Marcus Bontempelli and Toby Greene stand next to each other, wearing blazers that say "All Australian"

items.synopsis: Adelaide veteran Taylor Walker and GWS forward Toby Greene erched their names into the All Australian history books.

title.children: Toby Greene makes All Australian history

image.altText: An Indigenous flag held by a hand in a yellow, red and black parka

items.synopsis: Six years ago, while the sun crept up into the crevices of Uluru, history was being made by a few hundred First Nations people. Now, the rest of Australia can join in, writes Bridget Brennan.

title.children: This is a major moment in our history — and we may never get a re-run

image.altText: Elaine Pandilovski smiles for a photo, dressed in a blue scarf and grey cardigan.

items.synopsis: The family of Elaine Pandilovski speak outside court as her estranged husband is sentenced for murdering the woman described as a "wonderful mother" in her Melbourne home in July, 2020.

title.children: 'Enough is enough': Family speaks out as man sentenced to 24 years' jail for murdering his wife

image.altText: A modern-looking court complex behind a sign that reads "Bendigo Law Courts".

items.synopsis: The 35-year-old is accused of assaulting a child in the Bendigo area earlier this year. He has been released on bail.

title.children: Victorian teacher arrested on campus and charged with six child sex offences

image.altText: A map of Victoria showing councils with neutral positions on the Voice in grey and those with Yes positions in blue

items.synopsis: We asked every Victorian council where they sit ahead of the national vote on an Indigenous Voice to Parliament and most of them are on the fence.

title.children: What does your Victorian local council think about a Voice to Parliament?

image.altText: Paddocks covered with hail.

items.synopsis: The storm dumped large hail in the Tweed Shire, smashed skylights and felled trees. The SES says it could be a sign that storm season has started early and that there may be worse to come.

title.children: Ferocious hailstorm tears through northern NSW, residents warned to prepare for season to come

image.altText: Katta O'Donnell wears a black turtleneck and long hair, standing in a forest in a portrait.

items.synopsis: The federal government has agreed to settle a world-first court case accusing it of misleading investors by failing to disclose the risk climate change poses to its bonds.

title.children: In 2020, a uni student launched a world-first case against the federal government. They’ve now reached an agreement

image.altText: Man in black shirt speaking with canon in the background

items.synopsis: A judge will soon rule on whether the broadcaster established a public interest defence over 2021 reporting allegations of a war crime.

title.children: Former commando Heston Russell's defamation case against the ABC wraps up

image.altText: A court sketch of a man with long hair and a goatee beard.

items.synopsis: The daughter of a convicted killer confronts her father in the WA Supreme Court over the violent attack he inflicted on her two-year-old sister that led to her death 15 years later.

title.children: 'He took every hope': Woman labels father 'a monster' for fatal attack on her two-year-old sister

image.altText: Woman with pink dreads stands in front of car wreckage

items.synopsis: A massive drone strike on Russia, which targeted six regions, is believed to be Ukraine's biggest since Moscow invaded 18 months ago.

title.children: Large scale Ukrainian drone strike targets several regions across Russia, damages border airport

image.altText: A man up to his midcalfs in flood water taking a photo.

items.synopsis: Idalia was about 30 km south of Perry Florida, packing maximum sustained winds of 205 kph.

title.children: Hurricane Idalia lashes Florida, Georgia, bringing trees down and leaving thousands without power

image.altText: Gladys Berejiklian looking serious.

items.synopsis: The NSW corruption watchdog is cleared of maladministration following a probe into why it took so long to finalise its investigation into former premier Gladys Berejiklian.

title.children: ICAC cleared after taking nearly two years to release Berejiklian corruption findings

image.altText: ICAC NSW

items.synopsis: Vincenzo Badalati, Constantine Hindi and Philip Sansom accepted cash and gifts from a Chinese property developer, in return for favourable treatment over property proposals.

title.children: 'Boys weekends', cash and a Chinese developer: Former councillors took part in corrupt conduct, ICAC finds

image.altText: A bespectacled man in a blue suit coat folds his arms as he stands before framed documents hung on a white wall.

items.synopsis: Police allege a Cantonese work of fiction Andrew Chan edited for a writing competition three years earlier violated Hong Kong's national security law, and when they found out he was overseas they threatened his family with arrest if they did not contact him.

title.children: A piece of fictional writing has this Brisbane-based activist fearing he can never return home to Hong Kong

image.altText: Group of men in camoflage and berets stand around podium

items.synopsis: Gunfire was heard in the capital of the Central African nation as senior military officials appeared on television, vowing to close borders and dissolve state institutions.

title.children: Military officials seize power in Gabon, place president under house arrest hours after re-election

image.altText: Trees destroyed

items.synopsis: Trees covering the equivalent of 14 tennis courts of land have been cut and poisoned at Castle Cove, decimating important habitat for native animals.

image.altText: Girl raises hand in high school classroom

items.synopsis: Friday's planned teacher strike will see 167 South Australian schools close, with teachers set to walk off the job after the government and union failed to reach a new pay agreement.

title.children: More than 150 SA public schools to close due to teacher strike
